intro: Tephrosia plicata, commonly known as African leadplant, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Tephrosia plicata is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
